Method that initialises a CAN bus channel for systec. All following methods called on the same object will be using this initialized channel.

parameterdescription.para:
= 2 parameters separated by ":" like "n0:n1"
n0 = "st" for systec
n1 = CAN port number on the module, can be prefixed with "can"
ex.: "st:can1" speaks to port 1 on systec module at the ip
ex.: "st:1" works as well

one parameter: "p0", positive integers
"Unspecified" (or empty): using defaults = "125000" // params missing
p0: bitrate: 50000, 100000, 125000, 250000, 500000, 1000000 bit/s i.e. "250000"

memberdef.argsstring: (short cobID, unsigned char len, unsigned char *message, bool rtr=false)
memberdef.name: sendMessage

detaileddescription.para: Method that sends a message trough the can bus channel. If the method createBUS was not called before this, sendMessage will fail, as there is no can bus channel to send a message through.

parameterdescription.para: Identifier that will be used for the message.
Length of the message. If the message is bigger than 8 characters, it will be split into separate 8 characters messages.
Message to be sent trough the can bus.
is the message a remote transmission request?

detaileddescription.para: Obtains a Systec canport and opens it. The name of the port and parameters should have been specified by preceding call to configureCanboard()

simplesect.para: less than zero in case of error, otherwise success
